full_summary:
## Electrical Deficiency Correction at the High Commission of Canada in Nigeria

### Solicitation Summary

The Department of Foreign Affairs, Trade and Development (DFATD) invites bids from qualified contractors to provide construction labour and materials for the replacement of the electrical infrastructure of the Guard hut, workshop, drivers rest area, landscape lighting, annex containers, and Guards trailers at the High Commission of Canada in Nigeria, Abuja.

### Tender Details

- **Solicitation Number**: 24-260763
- **Publication Date**: 2024-02-13
- **Tender Closing Date**: 2024-02-23T14:00:00
- **Expected Contract Start Date**: 2024-03-04
- **Expected Contract End Date**: 2024-04-30

### Brief Description of Requirements
The services required for this project include the provision of construction labour and materials for the replacement of electrical infrastructure at various facilities within the High Commission of Canada in Nigeria, Abuja. The scope of work involves replacement of the electrical infrastructure of the main Guard hut, workshop, drivers rest area, landscape lighting,  annex containers, and Guards trailers.

### Request for Proposal Documents

- **RFP Document**: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31866/24-260763---rfp-en.pdf> (English)
- **Addendum 1**: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31866/24-260763---addendum01-en.pdf> (English)
- **Addendum 2**: <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31866/24-260763---qa02-en_0.pdf> (English)

### Inquiry or Show Cause Action

Please direct all inquiries or show cause actions to Meagan Leclair, [realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca](mailto:realproperty-contracts@international.gc.ca) or (343) 598-9721.

### Attachment File

Attachments are available for download from <https://canadabuys.canada.ca/sites/default/files/webform/tender_notice/31866/24-260763---attachment-file.pdf>. 

### Purpose
The Government of Canada tender process aims to reduce barriers to participation and provide opportunities for capable and qualified suppliers, such as Indigenous businesses, women-led businesses, and small and medium-sized enterprises, to submit
